reviewText: This is an interesting documentary based on the value of its being a  tribute to Spencer Tracy by Katherine Hepburn.  It was produced for public television in 1986 and is interesting because of the people involved and is a valuable piece of history.  It is also a bit slow moving and drags in parts.  Katherine's letter to Spencer at the end drags on way too long!  It meant a lot to her though.  I'm glad I saw it.
Showed movie history not much personal history.
This is what true love is all about. They lived happily ever after, even though Spencer Tracey was married the whole time!
Insightful and poignant remembrances by Katherine Hepburn
This was very interesting, but it didn't tell that much about his actual life, it focused mainly on his movies. I was more interested in learning something about his life and times.
DVD was a good copy &  was received within a few days.
Not as "tell-all" as I wished.  Good overview however
My favorite movie it was excellent.

A  N  Y  . . .  Opportunity to review the late, Great

  Spencer Tracy, should be deemed a pure pleasure.
